Class COM.sootNsmoke.jvm.JavaClass 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----COM.sootNsmoke.jvm.JavaClass
public class JavaClass
extends Object
A class to make it easier to build ClassFiles. It handles most of the string-valued constants as Strings instead of index entries, and it eliminates duplicate entries in the constant pool.

See Also:
ClassFile

JavaClass(InputStream)
Creates a new JavaClass using an existing class as the base.

JavaClass 
 public JavaClass(String name,
                  String base)
Create a new class

Parameters:
name - Name of the class, absolute (e.g. java/lang/Object)
base - Name of the base class, absolute
JavaClass 
 public JavaClass(InputStream is) throws IOException, ClassFileException
Creates a new JavaClass using an existing class as the base.

Parameters:
is - Holds a class file
Throws: ClassFileException
If there is an error in the class file format

createExceptionTableEntry 
 public ExceptionTableEntry createExceptionTableEntry(String catch_type,
                                                      int start_pc,
                                                      int end_pc,
                                                      int handler_pc)
Create an exception table entry. If there is no classname argument, then the catch_type is set to 0 (catch everything)

createExceptionTableEntry 
 public ExceptionTableEntry createExceptionTableEntry(int start_pc,
                                                      int end_pc,
                                                      int handler_pc)
Build an exception table entry which handles any exception between start_pc and end_pc, branching to handler_pc when an exception occurs.

createLocalVariableTableEntry 
 public LocalVariableTableEntry createLocalVariableTableEntry(int start_pc,
                                                              int length,
                                                              String name,
                                                              String desc,
                                                              int index)
Create an entry for the LocalVariableTable attribute.

Parameters:
start_pc - The offset where the local variable begins
length - The number of bytes that it is value for
name - The name of the local variable
desc - The type descriptor of the local variable
index - The local variable pool index of this variable
createLocalVariableTableAttribute 
 public LocalVariableTableAttribute createLocalVariableTableAttribute(LocalVariableTableEntry lvt[])
Create a LocalVariableTable attribute given the entries

createExceptionsAttribute 
 public ExceptionsAttribute createExceptionsAttribute(String exceptions[])
Given a list of names of classes which are exceptions, create an ExceptionsAttribute

addMethod 
 public void addMethod(String name,
                       String type,
                       int access_flags,
                       int max_stack,
                       int max_locals,
                       byte code[],
                       ExceptionTableEntry exceptions[],
                       Attribute code_attributes[],
                       Attribute method_attributes[])
Add a method to the class

Parameters:
name - The name of the method
type - Type of the method (in mangled format; e.g. ()V for function returning void)
access_flags - The access flags: logical OR of ACC_PUBLIC, ACC_FINAL, etc. from RuntimeConstants.
max_stack - Maximum number of words on the operand stack
max_locals - Number of local variables used, incl. params
code - Java bytecodes. (If null or empty, then no code attribute will be added)
exceptions - List of exceptions
attributes - List of additional code attributes. Currently, only LineNumberTable and LocalVariableTable are recognized.
Returns:
the index of constant_methodref the new method (what you'd give to invokevirtual)
See Also:
RuntimeConstants
addField 
 public int addField(String name,
                     String type,
                     int access_flags)
Adds a field to the class with no default value

Parameters:
name - Name of the field
type - Type of the field in Java VM mangled-typr-name format
access_flags - Access flags
Returns:
the index of the constant_fieldref used to access the field

setAccess 
 public void setAccess(int access)
Sets the access flags. access is the logical or the access settings. The access flags can be found in the RuntimeConstants package; the names begin with ACC_.

See Also:
RuntimeConstants
